site_name: St Luke's Chapel Rose Square, Fulham Road, LONDON
application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Details required by Condition 3 (submission of details -  b) detailed assessment of the age and contribution to the special interest of the building of the external, traditionally designed railings, and justification and a plan for their appropriate disposal if they are proposed to be removed; c) samples for new roofing materials to the chapel; d) details of new coating to flat roof of the rear extension, including colour; e) details of new rooflights, including framing, materials, colour and finish; g) trial patches for proposed light and non-abrasive stone cleaning methods; h) details of all new rainwater goods including plans and elevations at 1:50 and 1:20 of hoppers and sections or product information and materials as appropriate) and Condition 3b2 (details including size, design, materials and colour of any external vents or ducts, including louvres to church upstand) of planning permission PP/23/04643 (Change of use from chapel to a single residential unit (Class C3) with associated internal works, single storey rear extension, landscaping, new roof lights, replacement roof tiling)
